CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT were investigated in BHJ PSCs with the device structures of the standard configuration glass / ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PCDSeBT : PC71BM / Al. The PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio was optimized from 1 : 1 , 1 : 2 , 1 : 3 , to 1 : 4. The current-density-voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the devices under the illumination of simulated AM 1.5G conditions ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) are shown in Figure 4a and the parameters are summarized in Table 2. Without extensive optimization , the initial device fabricated from the blend solutions with a PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio of 1 : 1 shows a PCE of 0.73% with a J SC of 2.98 mA / cm^2 , a V OC of 0.71 V , a fill factor ( FF ) of 35% . As increasing the weight fraction of PC71BM , the PCEs are gradually increased. The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ). 20 It is worth noting that the J SC , to the best of our knowledge , is among the highest J SC s reported to date for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues , 5,8,21 in a good agreement with the 1.0 × 10^-3 4.0 × 10^4 -13 a All device characteristics were obtained from the devices ( L = 50 μm and W = 1.5 mm ) based on OTS - treated Si / SiO 2 substrates. b The on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) were extracted from the linear - regime transfer characteristics. In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error. Atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed to gain insight into the surface morphology of the optimized 1 : 4 w / w blend films ( Figure 5 ). The films before and after thermal annealing have smooth surface topographies and very similar features , where the formation of voids , typically attributed to incompatibility between donor and acceptor components , is not observed.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |
| PC71BM |
| PCDTBT |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| ITO |
| Al |
| Si |
| SiO2 |
| OTS |

Note:

* PCDSeBT, PC71BM, and PCDTBT are all materials used in the fabrication of the photovoltaic devices.
* PEDOT : PSS and ITO are materials used as electrodes in the device structures.
* Al is the material used for the Al electrode.
* Si and SiO2 are the materials used for the substrate.
* OTS is a material used for surface treatment of the substrate.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |
| PC71BM |
| PCDTBT |

Note:

* PCDSeBT, PC71BM, and PCDTBT are all materials used in the fabrication of the photovoltaic devices.

The other mentioned entities, such as PEDOT : PSS, ITO, Al, Si, SiO2, and OTS, do not clearly refer to material names and were removed from the list.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT were investigated in BHJ PSCs with the device structures of the standard configuration glass / ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PCDSeBT : PC71BM / Al. The PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio was optimized from 1 : 1 , 1 : 2 , 1 : 3 , to 1 : 4. The current-density-voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the devices under the illumination of simulated AM 1.5G conditions ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) are shown in Figure 4a and the parameters are summarized in Table 2. Without extensive optimization , the initial device fabricated from the blend solutions with a PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio of 1 : 1 shows a PCE of 0.73% with a J SC of 2.98 mA / cm^2 , a V OC of 0.71 V , a fill factor ( FF ) of 35% . As increasing the weight fraction of PC71BM , the PCEs are gradually increased. The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ). 20 It is worth noting that the J SC , to the best of our knowledge , is among the highest J SC s reported to date for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues , 5,8,21 in a good agreement with the 1.0 × 10^-3 4.0 × 10^4 -13 a All device characteristics were obtained from the devices ( L = 50 μm and W = 1.5 mm ) based on OTS - treated Si / SiO 2 substrates. b The on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) were extracted from the linear - regime transfer characteristics. In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error. Atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed to gain insight into the surface morphology of the optimized 1 : 4 w / w blend films ( Figure 5 ). The films before and after thermal annealing have smooth surface topographies and very similar features , where the formation of voids , typically attributed to incompatibility between donor and acceptor components , is not observed.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |
| PC71BM |
| J-V |
| PCE |
| J SC |
| V OC |
| FF |
| I on/I off |
| IPCE |
| λ max |

Note:

* PCDSeBT and PC71BM are materials, not properties.
* J-V, PCE, J SC, V OC, and FF are properties of the devices.
* I on/I off is a property of the devices, but it is not mentioned in the paragraph.
* IPCE and λ max are properties of the optimized device.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Property name of material" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |
| PC71BM |
| J SC |
| V OC |
| FF |
| IPCE |
| λ max |

Note:

* PCDSeBT and PC71BM are materials, not properties.
* J-V is not a property name, but rather an abbreviation for "current-density-voltage" characteristics.
* I on/I off is not mentioned in the paragraph.

The valid property names mentioned in the paragraph are:

* J SC (short-circuit current density)
* V OC (open-circuit voltage)
* FF (fill factor)
* IPCE (incident photon-to-current efficiency)
* λ max (wavelength of maximum absorbance)

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Photovoltaic effects of PCDSeBT were investigated in BHJ PSCs with the device structures of the standard configuration glass / ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PCDSeBT : PC71BM / Al. The PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio was optimized from 1 : 1 , 1 : 2 , 1 : 3 , to 1 : 4. The current-density-voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the devices under the illumination of simulated AM 1.5G conditions ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) are shown in Figure 4a and the parameters are summarized in Table 2. Without extensive optimization , the initial device fabricated from the blend solutions with a PCDSeBT : PC71BM weight ratio of 1 : 1 shows a PCE of 0.73% with a J SC of 2.98 mA / cm^2 , a V OC of 0.71 V , a fill factor ( FF ) of 35% . As increasing the weight fraction of PC71BM , the PCEs are gradually increased. The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ). 20 It is worth noting that the J SC , to the best of our knowledge , is among the highest J SC s reported to date for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues , 5,8,21 in a good agreement with the 1.0 × 10^-3 4.0 × 10^4 -13 a All device characteristics were obtained from the devices ( L = 50 μm and W = 1.5 mm ) based on OTS - treated Si / SiO 2 substrates. b The on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) were extracted from the linear - regime transfer characteristics. In order to ensure the accuracy of the measurements , we investigated the incident photon - to - current efficiency ( IPCE ) spectrum of the optimized device ( 1 : 4 w / w ) , exhibiting over 65% at the energetically lower peak , i.e. at the λ max of PCDSeBT ( Figure 4b ). The J SC value calculated by integrating the IPCE data with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum is rather consistent with that obtained from J-V plots within 10% error. Atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed to gain insight into the surface morphology of the optimized 1 : 4 w / w blend films ( Figure 5 ). The films before and after thermal annealing have smooth surface topographies and very similar features , where the formation of voids , typically attributed to incompatibility between donor and acceptor components , is not observed.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 100 mW/cm^2 | Illumination intensity under AM 1.5G conditions |
| 1:1, 1:2, 1:3, 1:4 | PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratios investigated |
| 2.98 mA/cm^2 | J SC (current density) of the initial device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:1 |
| 0.71 V | V OC (open-circuit voltage) of the initial device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:1 |
| 35% | Fill factor (FF) of the initial device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:1 |
| 11.7 mA/cm^2 | J SC (current density) of the optimized device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:4 |
| 0.79 V | V OC (open-circuit voltage) of the optimized device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:4 |
| 45% | Fill factor (FF) of the optimized device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:4 |
| 4.12% | PCE (power conversion efficiency) of the optimized device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:4 |
| 1.0 × 10^-3 - 4.0 × 10^4 | Range of J SC values reported for PCSs based on PCDTBT analogues |
| 65% | IPCE (incident photon-to-current efficiency) of the optimized device at the energetically lower peak |
| λ max | Wavelength of the maximum absorbance of PCDSeBT |
| 10% | Error margin in the J SC value calculated from IPCE data and J-V plots |
| 50 μm | Length of the devices |
| 1.5 mm | Width of the devices |
| OTS-treated Si/SiO2 | Substrate material |
| AFM | Technique used to analyze the surface morphology of the optimized 1:4 w/w blend films |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 100 mW/cm^2 | Illumination intensity under AM 1.5G conditions |
| 1:1, 1:2, 1:3, 1:4 | PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratios investigated |
| 2.98 mA/cm^2 | J SC (current density) of the initial device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:1 |
| 0.71 V | V OC (open-circuit voltage) of the initial device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:1 |
| 35% | Fill factor (FF) of the initial device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:1 |
| 11.7 mA/cm^2 | J SC (current density) of the optimized device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:4 |
| 0.79 V | V OC (open-circuit voltage) of the optimized device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:4 |
| 45% | Fill factor (FF) of the optimized device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:4 |
| 4.12% | PCE (power conversion efficiency) of the optimized device with a PCDSeBT:PC71BM weight ratio of 1:4 |

Note:

* J SC stands for "current density"
* V OC stands for "open-circuit voltage"
* FF stands for "fill factor"
* PCE stands for "power conversion efficiency"

The other mentioned entities do not clearly refer to the value of a material property and were removed from the list.
